Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has been experiencing fluctuations in their emotional state, feeling anxious and paranoid in social situations. They report feeling judged or watched, particularly in stores and unfamiliar places.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been trying to go out more but struggles on tougher days, particularly when feeling anxious. They have noticed that anxiety spikes in crowded or unfamiliar settings.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports improved sleep quality, attributing it to consistent yoga and meditation practices. They feel centered when they maintain this routine but experience increased anxiety and irritability when they miss sessions.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice affirmations to combat feelings of paranoia and anxiety. They have been applying coping strategies discussed in previous sessions.
Next Steps: The patient plans to create a step-by-step approach to gradually increase their comfort in going out, including setting specific goals for their yoga and meditation practices. They aim to discuss their progress in the next session.
